name: FundingCycles
description: Manage funding cycle configurations, accounting, and scheduling.

functionDecorators.name: BASE_WEIGHT
functionDecorators.description: The weight used for each project's first funding cycle.

functionDecorators.name: MAX_CYCLE_LIMIT
functionDecorators.description: The maximum value that a cycle limit can be set to.

functionDecorators.name: configure
functionDecorators.description: Configures the next eligible funding cycle for the specified project. Only a project's current terminal can configure its funding cycles._properties.target The amount that the project wants to receive in each funding cycle. 18 decimals._properties.currency The currency of the `_target`. Send 0 for ETH or 1 for USD._properties.duration The duration of the funding cycle for which the `_target` amount is needed. Measured in days. Set to 0 for no expiry and to be able to reconfigure anytime._cycleLimit The number of cycles that this configuration should last for before going back to the last permanent. This does nothing for a project's first funding cycle._properties.discountRate A number from 0-200 indicating how valuable a contribution to this funding cycle is compared to previous funding cycles. If it's 0, each funding cycle will have equal weight. If the number is 100, a contribution to the next funding cycle will only give you 90% of tickets given to a contribution of the same amount during the current funding cycle. If the number is 200, a contribution to the next funding cycle will only give you 80% of tickets given to a contribution of the same amoutn during the current funding cycle. If the number is 201, an non-recurring funding cycle will get made._ballot The new ballot that will be used to approve subsequent reconfigurations.

parameterDecorators.name: _projectId
parameterDecorators.description: The ID of the project being reconfigured.

parameterDecorators.name: _metadata
parameterDecorators.description: Data to associate with this funding cycle configuration.

parameterDecorators.name: _fee
parameterDecorators.description: The fee that this configuration will incure when tapping.

parameterDecorators.name: _configureActiveFundingCycle
parameterDecorators.description: If a funding cycle that has already started should be configurable.

returnDecorators.name: fundingCycle
returnDecorators.description: The funding cycle that the configuration will take effect during.

functionDecorators.name: count
functionDecorators.description: The total number of funding cycles created, which is used for issuing funding cycle IDs.

functionDecorators.name: currentBallotStateOf
functionDecorators.description: The currency ballot state of the project.

parameterDecorators.name: _projectId
parameterDecorators.description: The ID of the project to check for a pending reconfiguration.

functionDecorators.name: currentOf
functionDecorators.description: The funding cycle that is currently active for the specified project. This runs very similar logic to `_tappable`.

parameterDecorators.name: _projectId
parameterDecorators.description: The ID of the project being looked through.

functionDecorators.name: get
functionDecorators.description: Get the funding cycle with the given ID.

parameterDecorators.name: _fundingCycleId
parameterDecorators.description: The ID of the funding cycle to get.

functionDecorators.name: latestIdOf
functionDecorators.description: The ID of the latest funding cycle for each project.

functionDecorators.name: queuedOf
functionDecorators.description: The funding cycle that's next up for a project, and therefor not currently accepting payments. This runs roughly similar logic to `_configurable`.

parameterDecorators.name: _projectId
parameterDecorators.description: The ID of the project being looked through.

functionDecorators.name: tap
functionDecorators.description: Tap funds from a project's currently tappable funding cycle. Only a project's current terminal can tap funds for its funding cycles.

parameterDecorators.name: _projectId
parameterDecorators.description: The ID of the project being tapped.
